meanings.definition: To disturb the composure of; unsettle
meanings.sent1: The loud noise seemed to discompose the sleeping baby.
meanings.sent2: Unexpected news can discompose even the calmest person.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten tried to discompose the serious dog by jumping around.
meanings.sent4: The sudden change in weather discomposed the delicate balance of the ecosystem.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence in the haunted house discomposed the brave explorer.

meanings.definition: To disarrange or displace; put out of order
meanings.sent1: Please do not discompose the neatly arranged books on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The strong wind can easily discompose a carefully arranged pile of leaves.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel loves to discompose the neatly raked garden.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected visitor discomposed the meticulously organized office space.
meanings.sent5: The mischievous child discomposed the carefully set table with a playful gesture.
